data.title: Rotate characters in a string
data.statement:
Given a positive number {{n}} and a non-empty string [[S]], 

if <<n>> is a prime number, move the last character at the beginning of the string.

If <<n>> is not a prime number, move the first character at the end of the string.

Then print out the new string.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given a positive number n and a non-empty string S,

if n is a prime number, move the last character at the beginning of the string.

If n is not a prime number, move the first character at the end of the string.

Then print out the new string.
Input
Line 1: A number n
Line 2: A non-empty string
Output
Line 1: A rotated string
Constraints
S is non-empty string
0<n<100000
Example
Input
19
abcdefgh
Output
habcdefg
